intro: Xylopia mendoncae, commonly known as the Mexican bitterwood, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by berries that are typically dark purple when mature. Xylopia mendoncae is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
